trans-unit.source: The exception that is thrown when policy forbids code to run.
This exception is typically thrown when the code requests more permissions than the policy will grant or the policy is configured to prohibit running the code.
PolicyException uses the HRESULT CORSEC_E_POLICY_EXCEPTION.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of PolicyException, see the constructor.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PolicyException"></xref> class with default properties.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Security.Policy.PolicyException>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|`null`.| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The localized error message string.|
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PolicyException"></xref> class with a specified error message.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Security.Policy.PolicyException>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|`null`.| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The error message string.|
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PolicyException"></xref> class with serialized data.
This constructor is called during deserialization to reconstitute the exception object transmitted over a stream.
The object that holds the serialized object data.
The contextual information about the source or destination.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Policy.PolicyException"></xref> class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.
An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property.

The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or `null` if the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
The following table shows the initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Security.Policy.PolicyException>.
|Property|Value| |--------------|-----------| |<xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A>|The inner exception reference.| |<xref:System.Exception.Message%2A>|The error message string.|
The error message that explains the reason for the exception.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception.

If the `exception` parameter is not <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>, the current exception is raised in a <xref uid="langword_csharp_catch" name="catch" href=""></xref> block that handles the inner exception.
